thread.title: BBT Forum: Limited spaces available for London forum
thread.title_full: BBT Forum: Limited spaces available for London forum

title: BBT Forum: Limited spaces available for London forum
text:
0 comments Tom Newcombe Tue, 29 Sep 2015 10:25 Follow @thomasnewcombe Complimentary tickets are still available to travel buyers for Buying Business Travel’s autumn forum in London on Friday.
The event, supported by ACTE , will be held at the Grange City Hotel, London on Friday October 2.
The BBT Forums are an open platform for travel buyers offering an excellent opportunity for dialogue and debate on key issues with peers and industry experts.
This full day event will commence at 09.00 with networking refreshments and sessions from 10.00 - 16.35 followed by a complimentary drinks reception. We will focus on adapting to change and key factors driving changes and challenging traditions in the business travel supply chain
BBT editor Paul Revel said: “Our forums are a great way for travel buyers to get together and talk about subjects of mutual interest and concern. They're also excellent for two-way dialogue between buyers and suppliers on the most important topics affecting business travel.”
To book your place go to our dedicated forum website.
If you are a travel manager or buyer and do not have the budget to attend please contact Claire Robson at crobson@panaceapublishing.com or call +44 (0) 207 821 2700 and we will try and match you with a complimentary sponsor-hosted place.
